newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Moroccan tourism picks up in first seven months.
newsitem.headline: Moroccan tourism picks up in first seven months.

text.p: Morocco's tourism receipts rose 21 percent during the first seven months of 1996 compared with the same period last year, a tourism ministry spokesman said on Monday.
Receipts totalled 6.445 billion dirhams ($740 million) from 5.328 billion dirhams ($612 million).
A total of 918,496 tourists visited the North African country from overseas, an increase of 10 percent over the previous period's 835,257.
Visitors came mainly from France, Germany Spain and Britain.
Tourism is the second biggest foreign currency earner after expatriate remittances which stood at 4.305 billion dirhams in the first five months of 1996.
